title: Tin Buenafe
text:
Hey there! I’m Kristine Camille Buenafe, but I go by Tin.
I’m a PhD candidate at the Centre for Biodiversity and Conservation Sciences at the University of Queensland.
Don’t hesitate to get in touch through any of my socials!

Research interests







Featured publications

Buenafe, KCV et al. (in review). Current approaches and future opportunities in designing climate-smart protected areas. Nature Reviews Biodiversity.

review on how measures of climate change have been quantitatively and explicitly incorporated in the design process of area-based management tools (e.g., protected areas)

Buenafe, KCV et al. (2023). A metric-based framework for climate-smart conservation planning. Ecological Applications.

methods paper providing practical guidance on identifying and prioritizing climate-smart areas in conservation planning using climate metrics


See my Google Scholar Page for my entire list of publications.


Featured work

Involvement in the conservation planning work in

small-island Pacific nations with the Waitt Institute, and
the Weddell Sea (in the Southern Ocean) with the Norwegian Polar Institute

Development of an R-package for wrangling climate-model outputs

See my LinkedIn and GitHub for more details.
